summary: The "Child Care for Working Families Act" (H.R. 4418) aims to increase the quality and availability of child care and reduce costs for families. The bill establishes and funds programs to support child care, including birth-through-five programs and universal preschool initiatives. It provides grants to states, territories, and tribes to expand access, subsidize care costs based on a sliding scale, and improve quality through workforce development and program enhancements. The bill also includes sections on Head Start, extending durations, and increasing wages for child care workers.
